module.comment: Known issues: - currently not explicitly capturing timezone for callback time. Could lead to misunderstandings in countries with several time zones
module.name: Start

eventHandlingItem.label: Catch-all for all internal errors, incl. queue errors

output.name: Agents are busy
output.shortDescription: We appreciate your patience. Please continue to wait while we connect you to an agent.

outputItem.text: Please wait while we lookup your information.

outputItem.label: Please Wait Prompt
outputItem.text: Please wait one moment while we are connecting you.

menuItem.label: a - Live agent
menuItem.nluCondition: (family IN (4782 /** live **/, 119477 /** to live **/, 119170 /** assist **/,131635 /** agent **/, 152227 /** Live assist **/ ) OR this.wordlist="a,a),A,A)") ANDNOTEXISTS other.family IN (110446 /** call back **/, 49305 /** callback **/)

menuItem.dtmfKeys: (family=110446 /** return a call **/ OR family=110445 /** call back**/ OR family=43869 /** call **/ OR family=43869 /** voice call **/ OR family=49305 /** callback **/):text("Callback");
menuItem.label: b - Callback
menuItem.nluCondition: family IN (110446 /** return a call **/, 110445 /** call back**/, 43869 /** call **/, 43869 /** voice call **/,49305 /** callback **/) OR this.wordlist="b,b),B,B)"

menuItem.label: a - Wait
menuItem.nluCondition: family IN (119592 /** to wait **/, 15645 /** wait **/, 15590 /** stay **/, 115757 /** stay put **/, 120040 /** stay on **/) OR wordlist="a,a),A,A)"

menuItem.label: b - Callback
menuItem.nluCondition: family IN (110446 /** return a call **/, 110445 /** call back**/, 43869 /** call **/, 49305 /** callback **/) OR wordlist="b,b),B,B)"

text.name: AnnounceQueue
text.shortDescription: Please wait while we connect you to a live agent. The next available agent will text you back.

text.name: BackendError
text.shortDescription: Sorry, there seems to be a problem with the system. We regret the inconvenience, please try again later.

text.name: Hyperlink-Callback
text.shortDescription: You can request a callback at any time during your wait by sending "Callback", or shorter "CB"
text.altText: You can request a callback at any time during your wait by sending "Callback", or shorter "CB".

text.name: Hyperlink-Status
text.shortDescription: You can request for the queue status at any time during your wait by sending "Status".
text.altText: You can request the queue status at any time during your wait by sending "Status", or "S".

text.name: LiveAgentOrCallback
text.shortDescription: Would you prefer a) a live agent assist you here and now over SMS, or b) receive a voice callback at a time suitable for you?
text.altText: Would you prefer a) that a live agent assist you via Text now, or b) to receive a voice callback at a suitable time?

text.name: No match-exit
text.shortDescription: Sorry, I have trouble understanding you. Please try again later, thank you good bye.

text.name: RetainAttentionAgainPartA
text.shortDescription: Our agents are still engaged with other customers. We will connect you as soon as possible.

text.comment: We appreciate your patience. Please continue to wait while we connect you to an agent.
text.name: RetainAttentionAppreciatePatience
text.shortDescription: We appreciate your patience. Please continue to wait while we connect you to an agent.

text.name: RetainAttentionPartA
text.shortDescription: Please wait, all our agents are busy attending other customers.

text.name: RetainAttentionPartC1
text.shortDescription: You are the next caller in the queue.
text.altText: You are the next caller in the queue.

text.name: RetainAttentionPartD
text.shortDescription: callers ahead of you in the queue.
text.altText: callers ahead of you in the queue.

text.name: SorryNoAgents
text.shortDescription: Our apologies, but no agents are available to assist you right now. Please try again later.

text.name: ThankYouForUsingService
text.shortDescription: Thank you for using our text service.

text.name: WaitOrCallback
text.shortDescription: Please wait, all our agents are busy attending other customers. Your estimated wait time is:
text.altText: Would you like to a) wait or b) receive a voice callback?

logItem.label: Log POST Information
logItem.text: ***************************************************** Log POST Information Address: System:ANI ConversationId:

variable.buiDescription: The application uses one of the 3 message variations to send the caller while exiting.
variable.name: Exit Message 3
variable.value: Goodbye

variable.buiDescription: If you check this box then you MUST assign Outreach Voice Worktype in Configuration Manager->Inbound SMS Worktype.
variable.name: Allow Callback Schedules?
variable.value: false

variable.buiDescription: This is the message that application would send the caller while he is entering the queue.
variable.name: AnnounceQueue
variable.value: Please wait while we connect you to a live agent. The next available agent will text you back.

variable.buiDescription: This is the first attention retainer message after the queue announcement in loop iteration.
variable.buiLabel: Initial Attention Retainer in the loop
variable.name: Attention Retainer 1
variable.value: Please wait while all our agents are busy attending other customers.

variable.buiDescription: This is the second attention retainer message that caller would receive while in queue loop iteration.
variable.buiLabel: Second Attention Retainer in the loop
variable.name: Attention Retainer 2
variable.value: We appreciate your patience. Please continue to wait while we connect you to an agent.

variable.buiDescription: This is the final attention retainer message that caller would receive while in queue loop iteration.
variable.buiLabel: Final Attention Retainer in the loop
variable.name: Attention Retainer 3
variable.value: Our agents are still engaged with other customers. We will connect you as soon as possible.

variable.buiDescription: A message which caller would receive when an error occurs during the back end operations.
variable.name: Backend error
variable.value: Sorry, there seems to be a problem with the system. We regret the inconvenience, please try again later.

variable.buiDescription: Attention retainer sequence will be looped the number of times specified here. The default value is 3 this means the (3(LoopCounter)*(3(times)*30(hold time) i.e.,90 secs)) customer will be put in the queue for 270 secs.
variable.name: Counter: Queue Wait Loop

variable.buiDescription: The application uses one of the 3 message variations to send the caller while exiting.
variable.name: Exit Message 1
variable.value: Goodbye!

variable.buiDescription: The application uses one of the 3 message variations to send the caller while exiting.
variable.name: Exit Message 2
variable.value: Have a nice day!

variable.buiDescription: The application uses one of the 3 message variations to send the caller while exiting due to no agent availability. Along with the exit message.
variable.name: Exit when no agents 1
variable.value: Thank you for using our text service.

variable.buiDescription: The application uses one of the 3 message variations to send the caller while exiting due to no agent availability.Along with the exit message.
variable.name: Exit when no agents 2
variable.value: Thanks for using our text service.

variable.buiDescription: The application uses one of the 3 message variations to send the caller while exiting due to no agent availability.Along with the exit message.
variable.name: Exit when no agents 3
variable.value: Thank you for using our texting service.

variable.buiDescription: This is one of the three greeting messages that application uses to send the caller. It sends only one message to a given caller.
variable.name: Greeting Message 1
variable.value: Hello!

variable.buiDescription: This is one of the three greeting messages that application uses to send the caller. It sends only one message to a given caller.
variable.name: Greeting Message 2
variable.value: Hello there!

variable.buiDescription: This is one of the three greeting messages that application uses to send the caller. It sends only one message to a given caller.
variable.name: Greeting Message 3
variable.value: Hi!

variable.buiDescription: This is a no match exit message that caller would receive after they have exhausted all the retries.
variable.name: NM Exit Message
variable.value: Sorry, I have trouble understanding you. Please try again later, thank you good bye.

variable.buiDescription: At a given occurrence application uses one of the 3 message variations when a no match even occurs and allow the caller to retry again.
variable.name: NMGeneric Variation1
variable.value: Not sure I got that.

variable.buiDescription: At a given occurrence application uses one of the 3 message variations when a no match even occurs and allow the caller to retry again.
variable.name: NMGeneric Variation2
variable.value: Didn't catch that.

variable.buiDescription: At a given occurrence application uses one of the 3 message variations when a no match even occurs and allow the caller to retry again.
variable.name: NMGeneric Variation3
variable.value: Not sure I caught that.

variable.buiDescription: This is a message that application sends the caller when it knows there are no agents available to assist
variable.name: No agents available
variable.value: Our apologies, but no agents are available to assist you right now. Please try again later.

variable.buiDescription: Specify the time in seconds you would want the caller to be notified with a attention retainer message. Default: 30 seconds.
variable.name: Queue: HoldTime

variable.buiDescription: During the menu prompt if the caller chooses to wait. By default the caller will be on hold for long duration which is 120 seconds.
variable.name: Queue: LongWait

variable.buiDescription: Update the call priority to specified value from 1(Highest) to 10(Lowest) as necessary after the interval specified in "UpdatePriorityAfter". Note: The default value is 5.
variable.name: Queue: UpdatePriorityTo

variable.buiDescription: Call priority will be updated only when this value is greater than 0 and by default this value is set to 0 seconds.
variable.name: Update priority after

collection.name: Queue Statistics
collection.value: <root> <row> <col name="A">Value A1</col> <col name="B">Value B1</col> </row> <row> <col name="A">Value A2</col> <col name="B">Value B2</col> </row> </root>

expression.name: System:ANI
expression.shortDescription: Returns the phone number of the caller through Automatic Number Identification (ANI).

expression.name: System:Channel
expression.shortDescription: Returns the code of the channel (voice, video, text, web) currently used for this service.

expression.name: System:DNIS
expression.shortDescription: Returns the phone number of the service through Dialed Number Identification Service (DNIS).

expression.name: System:Dialog ID
expression.shortDescription: Returns the unique ID of the dialog as a string of 44 characters.

expression.name: System:Driver
expression.shortDescription: Returns a string which represents the media platform driver information of the corresponding service (e.g. Nuance_VWS_2_0_VXML_2_0 or IBM_WVS_2_0_VXML_1_0).

expression.name: System:Driver ASR Engine
expression.shortDescription: Returns a string which represents the name of the ASR engine (e.g. Nuance or Telisma).

expression.name: System:Exit Event
expression.shortDescription: Returns a string providing the corresponding exit event ending the dialog. Valid return values are: None, Timeout, Exception, EndOfDialog, CallerHangup, CallerExit, Transfer.

expression.name: System:Language
expression.shortDescription: When used without an argument, returns the code of the currently active language (e.g. en-US or de-DE). When used with an argument, it sets the currently active language to this value. Note that the underlying media platform must be configured appropriately to support the language that is being set.

expression.name: System:Module History
expression.shortDescription: Returns a comma-separated list of reference IDs of Module objects processed so far in the current dialog. When used without an argument the entire list will be returned, with the most current Module object at the top of the list. When used with an argument the value of the argument defines how far to go back in the processing history specifying where to start the list (e.g. level=1 means that the list starts with the previous Module object instead of the current one). If the specified level exceeds the size of the processing history an empty string is returned. NOTE: Only Module objects with the option "Enable history tracking" set to true are considered.

expression.name: System:Module Reference ID
expression.shortDescription: Returns the reference ID of a Module object processed in the current dialog. When used without an argument the reference ID of the currently processed Module object is returned. When used with an argument ([level]) the reference ID of a parent object of the currently processed Module object is returned. The value of the argument specifies how far to go up in the tree of processed modules (e.g. level=1 means that the reference ID of the parent of the currently processed Module object is returned). If the specified level exceeds the depth of the module tree an empty string is returned.

hyperlink.label: Callback Hyperlink
hyperlink.name: Callback Hyperlink
hyperlink.validationPattern: Callback,CB, cb,callback,call back, Call Back, Call back
